latestIgtvVideos.title: HYPERPIGMENTATION
latestIgtvVideos.caption:
HYPERPIGMENTATION PART 1

Hyper-pigmentation is a very vast topic which has been requested by quite a lot of you. So I decided to finally talk about it, it's a long video but bear with me.😊

In this video I have tried to explain the causes and types of hyperpigmentations in a very simplified form.

It is a very common skin condition that  experienced by almost every one at some point in life ,Especially by people of color as they are more susceptible to tanning and Hyperpigmentation.

Something as small as inculcating a habit of using sunscreen daily can actually save your skin from unwanted marks and discolorations.

Comment below with your experience with hyperpigmentation 👇

Stay tuned for part 2 with the treatment options and prevention.

latestIgtvVideos.title: HOW TO EFFECTIVELY REMOVE YOUR MAKEUP
latestIgtvVideos.caption:
I have an oily acne prone skin, which is why I always make it a point to double cleanse my face everyday, even on days when I am not wearing any makeup, this video is based on the routine best suited for my skin. 
People with different skin types can follow the first step but the final facewash/ cleanser should be according to their own skin type.

The benefit of double cleansing is that the first cleanser will break down any makeup, remove dirt and excess oils from the day and clean your skin. The second cleanser will address your particular skin type or concern and should have ingredients to hydrate, smooth or exfoliate and treat acne.

Products:
1. Innis Free - Micellar Oil Water ( suitable for all skin types )

2. Simple - Eye makeup remover ( very gentle can even be used to remove makeup by people with very sensitive skin )

3. Banilla co - Clean it Zero cleansing balm ( suitable for all skin types ) 

4. Bioderma - Sebium Gel Moussant face wash ( best for oily to combination skin )

#makeup #makeupremover #doublecleansing #innisfree #bioderma

latestIgtvVideos.title: Sanitize
latestIgtvVideos.caption:
Are you faithfully treating your acne but still seeing new breakouts? Your skin care routine could be to blame. 

I've got 3 very basic habits for you to add to your daily routine to help with unwanted breakouts!

 I started assimilating these habits since my college days when I started doing Hospital visits. As you all know hospitals are a cesspool of bacteria which led me to practice sanitising my phone everyday when I got back home, and then I started doing the same for my skincare products and my makeup products. 

It’s essential to keep your make up products clean just as much as your make up sponges and brushes. So, remember to sanitize your daily use items constantly! 

Stay tuned to discover more!

latestIgtvVideos.title: Melasma
latestIgtvVideos.caption:
One of the most frustrating pigmentations, Melasma causes patches of discolouration that are often found on the forehead, cheeks , bridge of the nose, and or upper lips.

Melasma gets triggered by various factors both internal as well as external. 

The Melasma of pregnancy is called #CHLOASMA.
Worsened by the UV rays , Melasma is every woman’s nightmare.

How wouldyou differentiate between  #hyperpigmentation and #Melasma ?

 ❇️Remember Melasma are large patches of pigmentations in symmetrical patterns. It affects both sides / halves of the face almost symmetrically.

❇️Hyperpigmentations on the other hand are rarely ever symmetrical and can occur anywhere on the body. 

There is no one correct way to treat Melasma. Each Melasma is unique and needs a multi faceted approach. Some available treatment options are

~ series of medical grade peels
~ some low frequency laser treatments
~ professional microneedling 
~ topical retinoids and TXA 
~ combination therapy with Adelaide acid , AHAs, Kojic acid 
~ oral tranaxemic acid
~ hydroquinone [ safety is still questionable] 
~ zinc oxide sunscreens

#melasmatreatment #hyperpigmentation #diy #bodypigmentation #sunscreen #glycolicacid #chemicalpeels #antioxidants #antiaging #retinols #microblading #microneedling #prpfacial #melasmacream #melasmalifestyle #skinpositivity #skincare #birthcontrolpills #ocpills #contraception

latestIgtvVideos.title: Dark circles
latestIgtvVideos.caption:
“The best bridge between despair and hope is a good night's sleep.”

Your health, mood, longevity and productivity are only some aspects of your life deeply influenced by the way that you eat and sleep. It is time you learn how.

By getting acquainted with the science behind sleep and taking nutritional diet, you will be able to improve your periorbital pigmentations to some extent

DIYs are not something you can swear by when looking at a serious concern... especially around the delicate eye area, knowing where to stop and seek advice from your doctor is the first step towards achieving good skin, good hair, and vitality. 

Our eyes both perceive and reveal our beauty. Make sure your resting enough... to avoid dark circles, it can help rejuvenate tiny muscles that have been taxed by hours of computer use or cellular use.

I have tried to explain how to differentiate between 
•vascular pigmentations 
•true melanocytic pigmentations 
•under eye hollowing

#KnowYourBody #ReadTheSigns #LittleChanges #BiggerProgress #Vitality #UnderEyeSkinCare #PuffyEyes #DarkCircles #BeautyTips #skincaretip #FrizzyHair #DryScalp #DeadSkinPores #SleepCycle #EightHoursOfSleep #BodyCycle #BodyClock #TakeAwaysFromThursdays #ThursdayTip #instadaily #instaskin #koreanskincare

latestIgtvVideos.title: Hair fall and its causes
latestIgtvVideos.caption:
Hairfall is a common concern for both men and women especially in these times of uncertainty and added stress.

I have tried to throw some light on the Most common causes for hair fall in this video 

- Genetic predisposition 🧬 
- Lifestyle and diet 🥘 🧘🏽🚭
- Nutritional deficiencies 💊 
- Hormonal imbalances 🧠🧪
- Hard water💧

I shall be discussing various modalities that can be used to treat hair loss, in the coming posts.

latestPosts.caption:
If you are expecting start this from day 1 . 

Also understand that 🧬 genetics play a huge roll in stretchmarks formation you may do everything right and still end up with stretchmarks and. THATS OKAY !! 

You are growing a tiny human inside of you and thats a true super power ✨

This video is just intended to share my experience and what I used… do not let unnecessary anxiety get to you during this time 🤰. Each individual is different- your body is beautiful regardless of some lines running across your body . ✨💕

latestPosts.caption:
Comment “Link” for Vitamin C Alternatives’ Product Recommendations, easily available in India.

If Vit C stings or breaks you out—
you’re not alone. I see this all the time.
💬🧴

Glow doesn’t need pain.
Your skin can thrive with other antioxidants.
Here’s what I use—for me + my patients:
🛡️✨

1️⃣ Resveratrol (0.5–1%)
– Fights radicals, builds resilience
– PM, pairs with soft creams
🌿💆🏻‍♀️

2️⃣ Green Tea Extract (EGCG)
– Calms, shields from pollution
– AM, pair with SPF
🍵☀️

3️⃣ CoQ10
– Brightens, repairs tired skin
– AM or PM, pair with barrier creams
💛🧴

4️⃣ Galactomyces Ferment
– Smooths texture, balances microbiome
– AM or PM, pair with ceramides
🧬✨

5️⃣ Heartleaf Extract
– Soothes, calms redness
– AM + PM, layer under light gels
🍃💆🏻‍♀️

6️⃣ Ginseng Serum
– Boosts glow, firms, protects
– AM or PM, pairs well with niacinamide
🌟🪻

Your skin’s not missing out by skipping Vit C—
you’re just choosing smarter, safer ways to glow.
🧠🛡️

Important tips to know before starting a new antioxidant:

I always start slow with new antioxidants—every skin has its pace. 🧠

I patch test for 48 hrs first—less risk, more calm. 🔬

Antioxidants + SPF? Cuts UV damage by 60%. ☀️🛡️

Hydrate before serums. Dry skin = more flares. 💧

No scrubbing before antioxidants—triggers redness. 🚫🧼

I switch formulas with seasons—light in heat, richer in winter. 🌦️

Consistent use (8–12 weeks) = real glow. 🗓️✨

Peptides + antioxidants = skin bounce boost. 🧬💪

Avoid stacking strong actives—skin can’t multitask when stressed. ❌⚠️

Stress + bad sleep = more breakouts. I see it daily. 💤🔥

💬 My tip:
Listen to skin signals. Redness isn’t always about actives—it’s about balance. 🛡️💆🏻‍♀️

Tight skin after washing ? 

That’s not clean. That’s a stripped barrier. ❌

If that is the case, pause. ⏸
Check your cleanser.

Oily skin doesn’t need harshness.
It needs respect.

That’s why I recommend Bioderma Sebium Gel Moussant for my oily + breakout-prone patients🧴

It cleanses without chaos.
No stinging. No stripping. Just calm.

Why this works?
✔ Clears dirt + oil
✔ Calms your skin
✔ Doesn’t pick a fight with your oil glands

You don’t need a full reset.
Just calm skin.

@biodermaindia 

#SebiumGelMoussant #DrSaruApproved #SkinThatMakesSense #BarrierCare #SmartCleansers #OilySkinHelp #DermRecommended #PostpartumSkin #RealNotPerfect #SummerSkinFix #Ad

#nonsponsored 
Scar repair needs strategy.

You need ingredients that:
– Calm the pigment machine (azelaic, niacinamide)
– Fade post-inflammatory signals
– Support collagen and cell turnover (centrally, not aggressively)
– Soothe the over-response (centella, onion, silicone gels)
🔬🧴🧊

It’s not about scrubbing it off.
It’s about teaching your skin to let go.
Gently. Daily. Consistently.
💆🏻‍♀️✨🕰️

I’ve used these formulas on myself too.
Not “just in theory”—but in real-time.
On scars that stayed for months.
On patients who thought nothing would work.

Dry, dull, itchy skin post-wash?
Fix your cleanser first.
Trust me. 

And if you’re using actives or have sensitive skin?
Your cleanser should calm—not stir things up.
🧘🏻‍♀️⚖️

Here’s what I look for:
– Low foam or no foam
– Creamy > squeaky
– Ceramides, panthenol, fatty stuff
– No fragrance, no sulfate drama
🧴🫧🚫

Breaking out after makeup? It’s not your skin. It’s your formula.

You don’t have to pick one.
You just have to stop using what’s working against you.
💄⚠️

I’ve seen too many patients break out worse after makeup—
Not because they wore it,
but because the formulas were comedogenic, occlusive, or full of irritants.
🧪🚫

Here’s what I tell them (and what I use myself):
Pick products that let your skin breathe while doing their job—
Blushes that don’t clog,
Foundations that stay matte without suffocating,
Setting sprays that don’t trigger flare-ups.
💆🏻‍♀️✨🧴

Because when your skin’s already fighting inflammation and oil,
Makeup should be an ally—not another stressor.
🔥🤝

What I look for:
✔️ Non-comedogenic ingredients
✔️ No heavy silicones or fragrance bombs
✔️ Lightweight textures that blend—not sit
✔️ A finish that looks like your skin—just calmer
🫧🌸

I’ve listed my go-to picks in this reel.
These work.
Not just because they say “acne-safe”—
But because I’ve used them, tested them, and watched them behave well on sensitized, oily, acne-prone skin.
🧴🔬✅

Your acne doesn’t cancel out your love for glam.
You can have both—clear skin and coverage.
You just need makeup that respects your skin.
Start here.
💖✨👩🏻‍⚕️

#DrSaruSays AcneSafeMakeup GlowWithoutBreakouts SkinFirstAlways #DermApproved MakeupForAcneProneSkin

If you’ve ever washed your face…
and still looked shiny 30 minutes later—
Hi. I see you. I was you.
👋🏼🪞😓

And no, it’s not because you didn’t scrub hard enough.
Or because “you just have oily skin.”
It’s usually because your cleanser is too harsh… or too soft.
🧼⚠️💧

Either way, your barrier’s confused—and your oil glands? On overdrive.
🧠💥

When I build routines for oily skin, I start at the root: cleansing.
Not with stripping foams. Not with strong acids right away.
But with the kind of cleansers that balance oil, reduce breakouts, and still… feel like care.
💆🏻‍♀️🫧🌿

Here are some cleanser picks that work with your skin, not against it:

1. CeraVe Foaming Cleanser Gel Moussant – Balances oil without stripping, barrier-loving formula.

2. Clin 3 Anti-Acne Foaming Cleanser – A derm-formulated pick for acne-prone skin that’s reactive.

3. Sebamed Clear Face Cleansing Foam – Gently deep cleans pores and controls breakouts.

4. Bioderma Sebium Gel Moussant – Refreshing gel that reduces oil and maintains skin microbiome.

5. Fixderma Mandefix Foaming Cleanser – Powered with mandelic acid, azelaic acid, salicylic acid & tea tree—great for congested, oily skin.

These are formulas I’ve personally tested, adjusted, and watched work on hundreds of faces.
Skin that flared at everything. Skin that never felt clean enough. Skin that just wanted peace.
🧪👩🏻‍⚕️🤍

So if your T-zone’s always on,
or your cheeks feel raw by evening,
or your pores feel tight and full at the same time—
pause. Let’s choose better.
⏸️🌡️🔍

In case you need help building a calm, clear, holding routine—
DM me anytime. I’ve got you.
📩🧴💬

Your skin’s not “sensitive.”
It’s overworked. Under-heard. And probably reacting to way too much.
⚠️🔥

✨ 3 baby products that work like barrier therapy (even for adults):

1️⃣ Diaper Rash Creams = Skin Crisis Fix
→ Use when skin’s burning, chafing, or reacting.
→ Zinc oxide forms a seal, calms inflammation, and helps skin heal, not just “feel better.”
→ I apply a thin layer on  rashes, underarms post-wax, even minor cuts.
🩹🧊
✅ Key concern: Redness, friction burns, peeling, mask irritation.

2️⃣ Baby Wash = Cleanser for Reactive Skin
→ When every face wash stings—this one won’t.
→ Gentle surfactants, no sulfates, no fragrance.
→ pH-balanced = keeps oils your barrier needs.
🫧🚿🌿
✅ Key concern: Burning post-cleanse, eczema-prone skin, post-treatment healing.

3️⃣ Baby Lotion = Everyday Calm in a Bottle
→ For tight, flaky, or angry skin—this brings it back.
→ Oat, calendula, ceramides, no perfume.
→ Light for body. Safe for face. Perfect during repair.
🌾🥛🧴
✅ Key concern: Dehydration, sunburn, flare-up-safe hydration.

I use these when skin’s too stressed to absorb anything.
When I’ve overdone it. Or when I just want healing without the guesswork.
😮‍💨💤

Because your skin doesn’t need trends.
It needs clarity.
And softness—with purpose.
🕊️💙

You’ll find that in the baby aisle.
Quiet. Effective. Non-irritating.

#SensitiveSkinCare #BarrierRepair #MinimalistSkinFix #InflamedSkinRoutine #ZincOxideCream #FragranceFreeLotion #EczemaFriendlyWash #DrSaru #BabyCareForBarrier #SimpleSkinHeals

Shampoo cleans. These clear.

You exfoliate your face.
But your scalp? Still waiting.
📍Flakes, buildup, oil, dull roots—it starts there.

Shampoo isn’t enough.
Especially if you oil, layer, or skip wash days.
That’s where scalp toners step in.

They’re gentle polishers.
No scrubbing. No stripping.
Just dead cell + buildup cleanup. Clean roots = better growth.

✨ Some of my go-to picks:

1️⃣ Deconstruct Scalp Toner – Salicylic + Lactic. Light, flake-clearing.
2️⃣ Minimalist Glycolic Toner – For oily, dull scalp. Works fast.
3️⃣ The Ordinary Glycolic – Strong. 1x/week. No overuse.
4️⃣ Paula’s Choice 2% BHA – Dandruff + bumps? This helps.
5️⃣ Minimalist PHA – My pick for sensitive scalps. Mild but effective.

🧴 How to use:
On clean dry scalp.
Apply part by part.
Keep on for 40 mins and rinse off

Dr. Saru’s Tip:
If you’re oily by Day 2, or hair feels heavy, start here.

It’s not just hair care—it’s scalp logic.
Quiet. Consistent. Game-changing.

Seasonal hair fall? 

Here’s where I start—with science, not guesswork:

1️⃣ Start at the roots—literally.
🌀 Touch your scalp before it touches your confidence.
massage for 5 mins daily.
Use a scalp massager or just your fingers.
It boosts 🩸 blood flow, oxygenates  follicles, and signals the roots to wake up and grow.

2️⃣ Choose smarter serums—without minoxidil initially 
💧 Support your scalp. Don’t shock it.
These are lighter, gentler, and still powerful:
→ Medpro-A hair serum
→ Kera XL hair growth serum 
→ Proanagen Advanced
→ Follirich hair growth serum
→ Densita
→ Q Sera hair serum

They stimulate follicles, reduce oxidative stress, and build density over time. 
I see the best results when applied nightly, not randomly. Use for atleast 4-6 months

3️⃣ Feed your hair internally too.
💊 Hair loss isn’t always outside-in. Often, it’s inside-out.
they work on the cell level.
They’ve got biotin, calcium pantothenate, and antioxidants.
They support scalp health, reduce breakage, and promote new strands that stay.

Extra  TIPS for my insta fam:

✨ USE CLEANSERS AS PER UR SCALP TYPE
✨ Switch to silk pillowcases—they reduce friction + thinning.
✨ Tie hair loosely. Tension = fall.
✨ Keep ferritin > 50. It matters more than just iron.
✨ Post-shower? Dab, don’t rub.
✨ INCREASE PROTEIN IN DIET 

This season, don’t just collect strands from your comb.
Take control. Stay consistent. Your hair listens when you care gently, not harshly.
It’s not vanity. It’s restoration.

— Dr. Saru

#SeasonalHairfall #HairCareTips #ScalpHealth #DrSaruSays #HairSupport #RootToTipCare #GentleScience
